details:
Several local and remote vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux
kernel that may lead to a denial of service or the execution of arbitrary
code. The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures project identifies the
following problems:


* [CVE-2004-0427](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0427)
A local denial of service vulnerability in do\_fork() has been found.
* [CVE-2005-0489](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0489)
A local denial of service vulnerability in proc memory handling has
 been found.
* [CVE-2004-0394](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0394)
A buffer overflow in the panic handling code has been found.
* [CVE-2004-0447](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0447)
A local denial of service vulnerability through a null pointer
 dereference in the IA64 process handling code has been found.
* [CVE-2004-0554](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0554)
A local denial of service vulnerability through an infinite loop in
 the signal handler code has been found.
* [CVE-2004-0565](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0565)
An information leak in the context switch code has been found on
 the IA64 architecture.
* [CVE-2004-0685](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0685)
Unsafe use of copy\_to\_user in USB drivers may disclose sensitive
 information.
* [CVE-2005-0001](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0001)
A race condition in the i386 page fault handler may allow privilege
 escalation.
* [CVE-2004-0883](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0883)
Multiple vulnerabilities in the SMB filesystem code may allow denial
 of service or information disclosure.
* [CVE-2004-0949](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0949)
An information leak discovered in the SMB filesystem code.
* [CVE-2004-1016](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1016)
A local denial of service vulnerability has been found in the SCM layer.
* [CVE-2004-1333](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1333)
An integer overflow in the terminal code may allow a local denial of
 service vulnerability.
* [CVE-2004-0997](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0997)
A local privilege escalation in the MIPS assembly code has been found.
* [CVE-2004-1335](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1335)
A memory leak in the ip\_options\_get() function may lead to denial of
 service.
* [CVE-2004-1017](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1017)
Multiple overflows exist in the io\_edgeport driver which might be usable
 as a denial of service attack vector.
* [CVE-2005-0124](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0124)
Bryan Fulton reported a bounds checking bug in the coda\_pioctl function
 which may allow local users to execute arbitrary code or trigger a denial
 of service attack.
* [CVE-2003-0984](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2003-0984)
Inproper initialization of the RTC may disclose information.
* [CVE-2004-1070](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1070)
Insufficient input sanitising in the load\_elf\_binary() function may
 lead to privilege escalation.
* [CVE-2004-1071](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1071)
Incorrect error handling in the binfmt\_elf loader may lead to privilege
 escalation.
* [CVE-2004-1072](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1072)
A buffer overflow in the binfmt\_elf loader may lead to privilege
 escalation or denial of service.
* [CVE-2004-1073](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1073)
The open\_exec function may disclose information.
* [CVE-2004-1074](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1074)
The binfmt code is vulnerable to denial of service through malformed
 a.out binaries.
* [CVE-2004-0138](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-0138)
A denial of service vulnerability in the ELF loader has been found.
* [CVE-2004-1068](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1068)
A programming error in the unix\_dgram\_recvmsg() function may lead to
 privilege escalation.
* [CVE-2004-1234](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1234)
The ELF loader is vulnerable to denial of service through malformed
 binaries.
* [CVE-2005-0003](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0003)
Crafted ELF binaries may lead to privilege escalation, due to 
 insufficient checking of overlapping memory regions.
* [CVE-2004-1235](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2004-1235)
A race condition in the load\_elf\_library() and binfmt\_aout() functions
 may allow privilege escalation.
* [CVE-2005-0504](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0504)
An integer overflow in the Moxa driver may lead to privilege escalation.
* [CVE-2005-0384](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0384)
A remote denial of service vulnerability has been found in the PPP
 driver.
* [CVE-2005-0135](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2005-0135)
An IA64 specific local denial of service vulnerability has been found
 in the unw\_unwind\_to\_user() function.


The following matrix explains which kernel version for which architecture
fixes the problems mentioned above:




|  | Debian 3.1 (sarge) |
| --- | --- |
| Source  | 2.4.17-1woody4 |
| HP Precision architecture  | 32.5 |
| Intel IA-64 architecture  | 011226.18 |
| IBM S/390 architecture/image | 2.4.17-2.woody.5 |
| IBM S/390 architecture/patch | 0.0.20020816-0.woody.4 |
| PowerPC architecture (apus)  | 2.4.17-6 |
| MIPS architecture  | 2.4.17-0.020226.2.woody7 |


We recommend that you upgrade your kernel package immediately and reboot
the machine.
